verses.text: The pride of the height, the clear firmament, The beauty of heaven, with \add his\add* glorious shew;
The sun when \add it\add* appeareth, declaring at \add his\add* rising A marvellous instrument, the work of the most High:
At noon it parcheth the country, And who can abide the burning heat thereof?

\add A man\add* blowing a furnace \add is\add* in works of heat, \add But\add* the sun burneth the mountains three times \add more;\add* Breathing out fiery vapours, And sending forth bright beams, it dimmeth the eyes.
Great \add is\add* the Lord that made it; And at his commandment it runneth hastily.
He made the moon also to serve in her season \add For\add* a declaration of times, and a sign of the world.
From the moon \add is\add* the sign of feasts, a light that decreaseth in \add her\add* perfection.
The month is \add called\add* after her name, increasing wonderfully in \add her\add* changing, \add Being\add* an instrument of the armies above, shining in the firmament of heaven;
The beauty of heaven, the glory of the stars, An ornament giving light in the highest \add places\add* of the Lord.
At the commandment of the Holy One they will stand in \add their\add* order, And never faint in their watches.
Look upon the \add rainbow\add*, and praise him that made it; Very beautiful \add it is\add* in the brightness thereof.
It compasseth the heaven about with a glorious circle, \add And\add* the hands of the most High have bended it.
By his commandment he maketh the snow to fall apace, And sendeth swiftly the lightnings of his judgment.
Through this the treasures are opened: And clouds fly forth as fowls.
By his great power he maketh the clouds firm, And the hailstones are broken small.
At his sight the mountains are shaken, And at his will the south wind bloweth.

The noise of the thunder maketh the earth to tremble: So \add doth\add* the northern storm and the whirlwind: As birds flying he scattereth the snow, And the falling down thereof \add is\add* as the lighting of grasshoppers:
The eye marvelleth at the beauty of the whiteness thereof, And the heart is astonished at the raining of it.
The hoar frost also as salt he poureth on the earth, And being congealed, it lieth on the top of sharp stakes.
When the cold north wind bloweth, And the water is congealed into ice, It abideth upon every gathering together of water, And clotheth the water as with a breastplate.
It devoureth the mountains, and burneth the wilderness, And consumeth the grass as fire.
A present remedy of all \add is\add* a mist \add coming speedily:\add* A dew coming after heat refresheth.
By his counsel he appeaseth the deep, And planteth islands therein.
They that sail \add on\add* the sea tell of the danger thereof; And when we hear \add it\add* with our ears, we marvel \add thereat\add*.
For therein \add be\add* strange and wondrous works, Variety of all \add kinds of\add* beasts \add and\add* whales created.
By him the end of them \add hath\add* prosperous success, And by his word all \add things\add* consist.
We may speak much, and \add yet\add* come short; Wherefore in sum, he is all.
How shall we be able to magnify \add him?\add* For he \add is\add* great above all his works.
The Lord \add is\add* terrible and very great, And marvellous \add is\add* his power.

When you glorify the Lord, exalt \add him\add* as much as you can; For even yet will he far exceed: And when you exalt him, put forth all your strength, \add And\add* be not weary; for you can never go far enough.
Who hath seen him, that he might tell \add us?\add* And who can magnify him as he is?
There are yet hid greater \add things\add* than these \add be\add*, For we have seen \add but\add* a few of his works.
For the Lord hath made all \add things;\add* And to the godly hath he given wisdom.
